file_content.text: I appear to be having trouble getting through to you, so let me ask directly: Where are the supplemental forces I requested?
I've taken your concerns regarding Kuat under advisement, Admiral, and ultimately deemed them unwarranted.
I apologize, Lord Grenthean. I should never have catered to your ego and led you to believe that you had a say in this matter.
Watch yourself, Ranken. You might have been safe under Grand Moff Kilran's apprenticeship, but you're on your own now. Do not overreach your grasp.
Mm. Staggeringly unfortunate choice of words.
You'll-- pay-- for--
Ah, hello there. Admiral Zasha Ranken, Imperial Forward Command. Might we have a word?
We can talk, but you had best respect me.
Yes, but be mindful.
I know who you are, my lord. Not terribly interested in crossing you. Recruiting you, however....
A rather bold move, Admiral.
You have my attention.
It took bold moves to get where I am today. Smart moves. I imagine you can relate, my lord.
I've got a minute, sure.
Go ahead.
Much appreciated, Hunter. I know your time's valuable. Of course, I'll compensate accordingly if you choose to help.
I'm no one to you.
Why me?
Maybe you are, and maybe you're not. Either way, I'm sure you'll find worth in what I'm trying to accomplish here.
That depends on the word.
Regarding?
Fair enough. How about "dominance"?
I saw what you did.
Technically, Lord Krovos did it.
Grenthean is a disingenuous bureaucrat. Worse than useless.
We're currently locked in a struggle--an ambitious, deadly and vital struggle--with Republic forces over Kuat Drive Yards.
Republic forces? What about the Treaty of Coruscant?
Yes, well, neither side is exactly advertising this conflict. The stakes are too high to draw undue attention.
Warship production here dwarfs that of most other manufacturers. Whichever side wins this battle will have the upper hand.
Ah, Lord Grenthean--how about we continue our discussion....
Enjoy your nap.
You can't do that to a Lord of the Sith.
Think you'll get away with choking out a Sith Lord?
Let's... pretend that never happened, shall we?
I have the ear of a Dark Council member or two.
We should talk in person. You'll need special security clearance to reach Kuat safely, but that's a small matter. Come join us in sealing the Republic's fate.
